bibl.title: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Emilie Lawrence Reed, April 2, 1924

div1.p: Kean expresses his disapproval of the claims made by Marie Gorgas' in her biography of William Crawford Gorgas.

div1.head: Letter from Jefferson Randolph Kean to Emilie Lawrence Reed, April 2, 1924
div1.opener:
RPB--8:31-23--100,000
HEADQUARTERS FIRST CORPS AREA
ARMY BASE
BOSTON 9. MASS. April 2nd 1924
IN REPLY
REFER TO
My dear Mrs Reed
div1.p:
Your letter of March 28th was
duly received and I have procured
and read the Chapter in The World's
Work by Mrs Gorgas and Mr Hendrick-
It is a very cleverly written article, &
apparently justifies the very scanty notice
of the work of the Reed Commission
by the statement at the foot of page 637
“The story of those next few months has fre-
quently been told- It is the story of Reed
and not the story of Gorgas”- The dis-
proval of Sanarelli's claim is credited
to “a group of Americans” when it
would have taken no more space to
say “The Reed Commission”-

But people have a right to write their
books in their own way and make
omissions if they want to- They have
no right to make false claims however
as is done when they say at the end of
Chapter III In the next few months however
" it was clearly to be shown that the stego-
" myia, and the Stegomyia only, was the
" infecting agent, and the man who was
" to make this clear for all time was
“Gorgas himself”- If there was one thing
which Reed did do and Gorgas did
not do it was just that thing!
The first column of Chap. IV on page
638 is pure bunk- We were all
familiar with H. O. Howards methods
of fighting mosquitos by kerosine-
I had recommended it in Key West in
1906 and had officially recommended
mosquito work on Oct - 15 - 1900 - G. O. No 6
Dept Cuba on the same subject was published
Dec 21, 1900 - Reed had no doubts at all
on the subject of how the work could
be done and my recollection is that
he outlined it before Gorgas had
accepted the mosquito theory.

But what to do about it I do not
know - or who to get to do it- Prof
Welch is the man but it is so hard
to get him to write anything - and

REFER TO
especially anything of a controversial
nature- And we all hate to attack
the statements of a woman who is writing
the biography of her husband-

I dont know what we can do- Gen-
Ireland has written to me about
your speaking to him but had not
read the article when he wrote-
My recollection is that Gorgas began
his mosquito work in Havana in
Feb- 1901 and its good effects did
not became evident until May &
June- I will have to look up these
points a little-

If Mrs Gorgas is going to put forth
such claims as this she ought to have
it intimated to her that her book
will be sharply reviewed by the friend
of Reed & of truth- I will write again
to Gen Ireland about it-

It is a great pleasure to hear from
you- I think I wrote you of my pleas
ure in seeing Lawrence Reed-
div1.closer:
Affectionately yours J. R. Kean See Havards Military Hygiene
2nd Ed- pages 68 and 69-
